Sentencas: Low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells require the use of cathodes with improved performance.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization

Sentencas: In this context, microstructural optimization is fundamental in order to obtain more efficient and stable materials.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization

Sentencas: However, most of the current fabrication techniques involve multiple steps and therefore they are not suitable for industrial applications.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization

Sentencas: This report describes alternative strategies to prepare PrBaCo2O5+ d (PBC) cathodes by using a simple and economic spray-pyrolysis deposition (SP) method.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization

Sentencas: Three different electrode configurations have been tested: (i) PBC prepared by spray-pyrolysis on dense CGO pellets, (ii) PBC deposited onto porous CGO backbone layers and (iii) submicrometric PBC powders prepared from freeze-dried precursors and deposited by a screen-printing process.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization

Sentencas: The second approach is an alternative to the traditional wet infiltration method with a number of advantages, such as a shorter preparation time and simplicity of implementation at industrial scale.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization

Sentencas: Reduced values of polarization resistance (R-p) are obtained at 600 degrees C, 0.027 Omega cm(2) for SP electrodes on porous CGO backbones, in comparison to 0.22 U cm2 for submicrometric powder cathodes by screen-printing.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization

Sentencas: Moreover, SP electrodes demonstrate improved stability with stable R-p values at 650 degrees C over time.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization

Sentencas: A Ni-CGO anode-supported cell with an SP cathode achieves a remarkable peak power density of 0.95 W cm(-2) at 600 degrees C in comparison to 0.6 W cm(-2) for the cell with a screen-printed cathode.
Titulo: Improving the efficiency of layered perovskite cathodes by microstructural optimization
